intro: Tarasa heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf tarasa, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying a variety of leaf shapes that adapt to different environmental conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow to orange in color, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Tarasa heterophylla is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
